definition: to die/to shoot dead/to reject/to fall forward/(suffix) to death

sentences.english: I can pull an awful lot of cool stuff from it.
sentences.chinese: 我可以從上面下載很多酷斃了的東西。

sentences.english: Does the idea of making a home in a foreign destination sound crazy? Or awesome?
sentences.chinese: 在一個陌生的地方再次安家，是瘋狂還是酷斃了？

sentences.english: But then it comes down to that notion of “I want” and “that's cool”.
sentences.chinese: 但之後就會變成“我想做”以及“酷斃了”。

sentences.english: Come on, all the cool kids drink.
But then it comes down to that notion of “I want” and “that’s cool”.
sentences.chinese: 但之後就會變成“我想做”以及“酷斃了”。

sentences.english: Its a beautiful place and the restaurants kick ass.
sentences.chinese: 那是個美麗的地方，而且那裏的餐館，酷斃了。

definition: to ask a question, already knowing the answer
lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
lit. in the eyes of a lover appears 西施[Xi1 shi1] (idiom); fig. beauty is in the eye of the beholder
pinyin: qing2 ren2 yan3 li3 chu1 Xi1 shi1

definition: lolicon or rorikon (Japanese loanword)/manga or anime genre depicting young girls in an erotic manner
lit. one hundred shots, one hundred hits/to carry out a task with great precision/to shoot with unfailing accuracy/be a crack shot (idiom)
La Comédie humaine, series of novels by 19th century French novelist Honoré de Balzac 巴爾扎克|巴尔扎克[Ba1 er3 zha1 ke4]
(slang) to target an intoxicated person for sexual assault
